verses.verse: My son <WH1121>, keep <WH8104> <WH8798> my words <WH561>, and lay up <WH6845> <WH8799> my Mitzvot <WH4687> with thee.
Keep <WH8104> <WH8798> my Mitzvot <WH4687>, and live <WH2421> <WH8798>; and my Torah <WH8451> as the apple <WH380> of thine eye <WH5869>.
Bind <WH7194> <WH8798> them upon thy fingers <WH676>, write <WH3789> <WH8798> them upon the table <WH3871> of thine heart <WH3820>.
Say <WH559> <WH8798> unto wisdom <WH2451>, Thou art my sister <WH269>; and call <WH7121> <WH8799> understanding <WH998> thy kinswoman <WH4129>:
That they may keep <WH8104> <WH8800> thee from the strange <WH2114> <WH8801> woman <WH802>, from the stranger <WH5237> which flattereth <WH2505> <WH8689> with her words <WH561>.
For at the window <WH2474> of my house <WH1004> I looked <WH8259> <WH8738> through my casement <WH822>,
And beheld <WH7200> <WH8799> among the simple ones <WH6612>, I discerned <WH995> <WH8799> among the youths <WH1121>, a young man <WH5288> void <WH2638> of understanding <WH3820>,
Passing through <WH5674> <WH8802> the street <WH7784> near <WH681> her corner <WH6434>; and he went <WH6805> <WH8799> the way <WH1870> to her house <WH1004>,
In the twilight <WH5399>, in the evening <WH3117> <WH6153>, in the black <WH380> and dark <WH653> night <WH3915>:
And, behold, there met <WH7125> <WH8800> him a woman <WH802> with the attire <WH7897> of an harlot <WH2181> <WH8802>, and subtil <WH5341> <WH8803> of heart <WH3820>.
(She is loud <WH1993> <WH8802> and stubborn <WH5637> <WH8802>; her feet <WH7272> abide <WH7931> <WH8799> not in her house <WH1004>:
Now <WH6471> is she without <WH2351>, now <WH6471> in the streets <WH7339>, and lieth in wait <WH693> <WH8799> at <WH681> every corner <WH6438>.)
So she caught <WH2388> <WH8689> him, and kissed <WH5401> <WH8804> him, and with an impudent <WH5810> <WH8689> face <WH6440> said <WH559> <WH8799> unto him,
I have peace <WH8002> offerings <WH2077> with me; this day <WH3117> have I payed <WH7999> <WH8765> my vows <WH5088>.
Therefore came I forth <WH3318> <WH8804> to meet <WH7125> <WH8800> thee, diligently to seek <WH7836> <WH8763> thy face <WH6440>, and I have found <WH4672> <WH8799> thee.
I have decked <WH7234> <WH8804> my bed <WH6210> with coverings <WH4765> of tapestry, with carved <WH2405> works, with fine linen <WH330> of Egypt <WH4714>.
I have perfumed <WH5130> <WH8804> my bed <WH4904> with myrrh <WH4753>, aloes <WH174>, and cinnamon <WH7076>.
Come <WH3212> <WH8798>, let us take our fill <WH7301> <WH8799> of love <WH1730> until the morning <WH1242>: let us solace <WH5965> <WH8691> ourselves with loves <WH159>.
For the goodman <WH376> is not at home <WH1004>, he is gone <WH1980> <WH8804> a long <WH7350> journey <WH1870>:
He hath taken <WH3947> <WH8804> a bag <WH6872> of money <WH3701> with him <WH3027>, and will come <WH935> <WH8799> home <WH1004> at the day <WH3117> appointed <WH3677>.
With her much <WH7230> fair speech <WH3948> she caused him to yield <WH5186> <WH8689>, with the flattering <WH2506> of her lips <WH8193> she forced <WH5080> <WH8686> him.

He goeth <WH1980> <WH8802> after <WH310> her straightway <WH6597>, as an ox <WH7794> goeth <WH935> <WH8799> to the slaughter <WH2874>, or as a fool <WH191> to the correction <WH4148> of the stocks <WH5914>;

Till a dart <WH2671> strike <WH6398> <WH8762> through his liver <WH3516>; as a bird <WH6833> hasteth <WH4116> <WH8763> to the snare <WH6341>, and knoweth <WH3045> <WH8804> not that it is for his life <WH5315>.
Hearken <WH8085> <WH8798> unto me now therefore, O ye children <WH1121>, and attend <WH7181> <WH8685> to the words <WH561> of my mouth <WH6310>.
Let not thine heart <WH3820> decline <WH7847> <WH8799> to her ways <WH1870>, go not astray <WH8582> <WH8799> in her paths <WH5410>.
For she hath cast down <WH5307> <WH8689> many <WH7227> wounded <WH2491>: yea, many strong <WH6099> men have been slain <WH2026> <WH8803> by her.
Her house <WH1004> is the way <WH1870> to SH'ol <WH7585>, going down <WH3381> <WH8802> to the chambers <WH2315> of death <WH4194>.
